name: Unique Learning System
description: Comprehensive, standards-aligned curriculum designed specifically for students with moderate to severe disabilities. Provides differentiated instruction with interactive lessons, assessments, and data tracking.
features: Interactive lessons; Differentiated content; Standards alignment; Progress monitoring; Assessment tools; Data reporting
subjects: ELA/Reading; Math; Science; Social Studies; Life Skills; Special Education

name: SIRAS Systems
description: IEP data management and special education compliance platform used by school districts to track student progress, manage caseloads, and ensure regulatory compliance.
features: IEP creation & tracking; Progress monitoring; Case management; Compliance reporting; Data analytics; Parent communication
subjects: Special Education Administration; IEP Management

name: SEIS (Special Education Information System)
description: California's most widely used special education IEP program, providing web-based centralized management of IEPs and special education student records. Used by over 950 California school districts, supporting 75,000 teachers and 700,000 special education students. Enables standardized IEP forms, goal writing with 10,000+ goals and objectives, and electronic student record transfers between districts.
features: IEP creation & management; Online student records; CALPADs reporting; Service tracking; DRDP forms; Progress reports; 24/7 multi-device access; SIS integration; Standardized goal library; Electronic record transfers; State compliance reporting
subjects: Special Education Administration; IEP Management; Data Reporting

name: LessonPix Visual Schedules
description: Visual schedule creation tool that helps students with autism and special needs understand daily routines through picture-based schedules and social stories.
features: Visual schedules; Picture library; Customizable templates; Social stories; Routine building; Print capabilities
subjects: Special Education; Life Skills; Behavior Management

name: SymbolStix PRIME
description: Symbol-based learning platform with over 90,000 educational symbols designed to support literacy, communication, and curriculum access for diverse learners.
features: Symbol library (90,000+ symbols); Literacy support; Curriculum integration; Communication aids; Customizable materials; Multi-language support
subjects: ELA/Reading; Communication & AAC; Life Skills; Special Education

name: Boardmaker
description: Industry-leading symbol and communication software that helps create visual supports, communication boards, and educational materials for students with special needs.
features: Communication boards; Symbol library (80,000+ PCS symbols); Template creation; Visual supports; AAC tools; Print & digital formats
subjects: Communication & AAC; Life Skills; Special Education

name: Verbal Me
description: Speech-generating AAC and choice board app designed for nonverbal students with autism and communication difficulties.
features: Voice output; 100+ prebuilt pages; Customizable buttons; Picture communication; Switch access; Offline capability
subjects: Communication & AAC; Special Education

name: GoTalk NOW
description: Communication app that turns tablets and smartphones into speech-generating devices with customizable communication pages and natural-sounding voices.
features: Speech generation; Customizable pages; Natural voices; Picture support; Easy navigation; Cloud sync
subjects: Communication & AAC; Speech Therapy; Special Education

name: Boom Cards
description: Interactive, self-checking digital task cards that engage students in game-like learning activities with instant feedback.
features: Self-checking activities; Interactive games; Progress tracking; Multi-device access; Teacher dashboard; Standards alignment
subjects: ELA/Reading; Math; Science; Social Studies; ESL; Special Education

name: Padlet
description: Collaborative digital bulletin board for posting and organizing multimedia content (text, images, audio, video, links).
features: Multimedia posts; Customizable layouts; Templates; Privacy & permissions settings; Real-time collaboration; Link sharing
subjects: All Subjects; Collaboration; Project-Based Learning

name: ParentSquare
description: School-district communication and engagement platform for messaging, announcements, and parent/family interaction.
features: Two-way messaging; Mass notifications; Translations (100+ languages); Document delivery; Calendars; Forms; Social media integration
subjects: School Communication; Family Engagement; Special Education Administration

name: ClassDojo
description: Classroom communication, behavior tracking, and parent engagement app used by teachers, students, and families.
features: Teacher-family messaging; Class Story; Behavior tracking/points; Student portfolios; Class tools (groups, timers, noise monitor)
subjects: Classroom Management; Parent Communication; Behavior & Engagement

name: ABSI Social Stories
description: Free library of social stories and video narratives supporting social skills learning for individuals with autism.
features: Downloadable social stories; Video gallery; Topics include routines & social situations; Free access
subjects: Social Skills; Autism Support; Behavior Management

name: Epic!
description: Digital library providing unlimited access to over 40,000 books, audiobooks, and educational videos for children. Free for educators during school hours, with options for family subscriptions at home.
features: 40,000+ books & videos; Read-to-me & audiobook formats; Quizzes & badges; Reading level filters; Multi-language support (Spanish, French, Chinese); Teacher assignment tools; Progress tracking; Offline reading capability
subjects: ELA/Reading; Literacy; ESL; General Education

name: Lexia Core5 Reading
description: Research-proven adaptive literacy program built on the science of reading that provides personalized learning paths in phonological awareness, phonics, fluency, vocabulary, and comprehension with embedded assessment technology.
features: Adaptive personalized learning; Science of reading based; Embedded assessment; Real-time data & reporting; Offline instructional resources; Teacher resources & professional development; Supports English learners; ESSA-approved efficacy research
subjects: ELA/Reading; Literacy; Intervention; Special Education

name: IXL
description: Comprehensive personalized learning platform with over 8,500 adaptive skills across multiple subjects. Provides unlimited practice with instant feedback, diagnostic assessments, and actionable analytics for teachers.
features: 8,500+ adaptive skills; Real-Time Diagnostic; Personalized skill recommendations; Instant feedback & explanations; Progress tracking & analytics; Standards alignment; Awards & certificates; Multi-device access
subjects: Math; ELA/Reading; Science; Social Studies; Spanish

name: Microsoft Immersive Reader
description: Free accessibility tool built into Microsoft products that improves reading and writing through text-to-speech, adjustable text formatting, translation, picture dictionary, and grammar tools for learners of all abilities.
features: Text-to-speech (read aloud); Adjustable text size, spacing & fonts; Translation (60+ languages); Picture dictionary; Syllable breakdown; Parts of speech highlighting; Line focus; Page themes; Built into Word, OneNote, Edge, Teams, Outlook, Forms
subjects: Accessibility; ELA/Reading; ESL; Special Education; All Subjects

name: GoNoodle
description: Free movement and mindfulness platform featuring interactive videos and activities that get students moving through dance, exercise, yoga, and breathing exercises to support physical activity and brain breaks.
features: Movement videos (dance, exercise, yoga); Mindfulness activities; Brain breaks; Breathing exercises; Class tracking with Champs; Educator resources; Multi-device access (web, iOS, Android); Free for educators & families
subjects: Physical Education; Health & Wellness; Classroom Management; Brain Breaks

name: Flocabulary
description: Standards-aligned educational platform using hip-hop videos and music to teach vocabulary, academic content, and skills across all subjects for K-12. Features 1,300+ video lessons with interactive activities, student creativity tools, and assessment capabilities to boost engagement and comprehension.
features: 1,300+ hip-hop video lessons; Standards alignment; Vocab Cards & Games; Interactive quizzes (auto-graded); Read & Respond activities; Lyric Lab (student rap creation); Week in Rap current events; Rhyming dictionary; Progress tracking & analytics; LMS integration (Google Classroom, Clever, Classlink); Teacher resources & printables
subjects: ELA/Reading; Math; Science; Social Studies; Vocabulary; Current Events; All Subjects

name: Iron Chef EduProtocol
description: Student-centered gamified jigsaw presentation protocol inspired by the Iron Chef cooking show. Students work in teams to research topics, create collaborative slide presentations within a time limit, and present findings to peers. Promotes teamwork, critical thinking, and concise presentation skills through repeated practice with any content.
features: Collaborative group work; Timed presentations; Research synthesis; Slide deck templates; Peer presentations; Any subject adaptability; Repeated practice structure; Engagement through gamification
subjects: All Subjects; Presentation Skills; Collaboration; Research

name: SchoolAI
description: AI-powered classroom experience platform providing personalized learning for students and productivity tools for teachers. Features Spaces (interactive AI-powered lessons), Sidekick (AI tutor for students), and Dot (lesson creation assistant). Includes real-time dashboards for teachers to monitor student progress and engagement. Used in over 1 million classrooms across 80+ countries.
features: AI tutors for students; Lesson creation tools; Real-time progress monitoring; 200,000+ shared Spaces; Personalized learning paths; Multi-language support (99+ languages); Safety monitoring; Standards alignment; LMS integration; Free for teachers
subjects: All Subjects; AI Literacy; Personalized Learning; Teacher Productivity

name: Curriculum Genie
description: AI curriculum agent that helps educators develop comprehensive teaching units in minutes using advanced AI (GPT-4, GPT-O1). Creates standards-aligned, personalized lesson plans with Universal Design for Learning and culturally responsive pedagogy. Supports IEP/ELD differentiation, interdisciplinary learning, and integrates with EduProtocols. ESSA Tier 3 Promising Evidence through Johns Hopkins study. Used by 300+ LEAs and 50,000+ educators worldwide.
features: AI-powered unit planning; Standards alignment (40+ states); UDL & culturally responsive teaching; IEP/ELD differentiation; Formative assessments by DOK levels; EduProtocols integration; Portrait of Graduate alignment; FERPA compliant; Chrome extension; Google Drive/Classroom integration
subjects: All Subjects; Curriculum Design; Lesson Planning; Inclusive Education

name: ParaFLY EduProtocol
description: Quick paraphrasing activity protocol that helps students simplify complex text to demonstrate understanding. Students read challenging passages, paraphrase them into their own words, and share with peers. Designed to build paraphrasing skills through frequent, low-stakes practice with teacher feedback. Related to summarizing with high effect size for comprehension.
features: Text comprehension practice; Paraphrasing skill development; Peer discussion; Teacher feedback; Low cognitive load start; Repeated practice structure; Works with primary/secondary sources; Multiple platform compatibility (Peardeck, Nearpod, Socrative)
subjects: ELA/Reading; Social Studies; History; All content areas requiring text analysis

name: 3XPOV EduProtocol
description: Perspective-taking writing protocol that engages students in writing from three different points of view about the same topic or event. Students practice writing with varied perspectives and then discuss in small groups which elements align with different viewpoints. Enhances reading comprehension (24 percentile point gain when writing about reading) and develops critical analysis of primary and secondary sources.
features: Multiple perspective writing; Small group discussion; Source analysis; Point of view practice; Comprehension enhancement; Template-based structure; Works with narrative, explanatory & persuasive writing; Created by Josie Wozniak
subjects: ELA/Reading; Social Studies; History; Writing; Critical Thinking

name: Sketch & Tell EduProtocol
description: Three-part visual learning protocol where students sketch responses to prompts, discuss with partners, and write reflectively. Combines visual and verbal processing to deepen understanding. Can be customized with various media (drawing tools, Legos, playdough, AI image generators). Integrates Webb's Depth of Knowledge levels for scaffolding from basic recall to extended thinking.
features: Visual representation creation; Partner discussion; Reflective writing; Multiple media options; DOK level integration; 5-30 minute sessions; Timer-based; Summary writing scaffolding; Vocabulary comprehension; Note-taking support
subjects: All Subjects; Visual Arts; Critical Thinking; Summary Writing; Vocabulary
